intro: Pootia exauriculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pootia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
